text:
This is a 62 yo M with pmh of kidney transplant in [**Country 297**] 3 years ago
   who has been in the US for the last 4 months and is experiencing
   intermittent fevers to 102 without source for the last week.  He was at
   [**Hospital1 1200**] for these fevers for the last 3 days without a diagnosis and
   has continued to experience fevers at home.  There he was given Zosyn
   without improvement. He therefore presented to the ED for further
   evaluation.
   .
   In the ED, initial VS were 99.2 101 18 136/83 97% on RA.  His blood
   work revealed a lactate of 7.5, an LDH of 2635 and an AG acidosis.  He
   also had a leukocytosis with left shift.  He spiked a fever to 102.6
   and was given tylenol 1 gm, vanc/cefepime given concern for fever in
   the setting of immunocomprise.  He rec'd a total of 4L of NS.  His
   lactate came down to 5.4.  He was HD stable throughout his ED stay, but
   given his elevated lactate, he was transferred to the ICU for closer
   monitoring.
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   Afebrile this shift., cx. Data pnding. WBC 14.5. Lactate down to 4.5
   (reportedly fevers have diurnal pattern.)
   Action:
   Antibiotics held, continued monitoring, fluid resuscitation.
   Response:
   Afebrile since admission, lactate decreasing to 4.5
   Plan:
   Continue monitoring for temp curve, F/U culture results, ID consult
   this AM. CMV/EBV labs sent to eval. For PTLD. Considering Lymph node
   biopsy.
   .H/O renal failure, Chronic (Chronic renal failure, CRF, Chronic kidney
   disease)
   Assessment:
   h/o renal transplant 3yrs ago in [**Country 297**], He does report increased
   frequency of urination with decrease volume of urine for the last 4
   days.  No burning with urination.  No tenderness over his transplant
   site. decreased PO intake over the last week
   Action:
   Fluid resuscitation NS 150ml/hr
   Response:
   BUN 24 and creat 1.2, voiding good amount of urine.
   Plan:
   Monitor labs,continue cyclosporine 70 po , monitor UO and labs, F/U Ct
   abdomen/pelvis results
   PT w/ subjective feelings of sob. LS CTA, sats 95-98% on RA.
